alert.note: Alert for Dunklin (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 08 at 7:16PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of East Arkansas and Southeast Missouri, including the following counties, in East Arkansas, Clay and Greene. In Southeast Missouri, Dunklin. * WHEN...Until 1015 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 716 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 3 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Paragould, Piggott, Campbell, Rector, Marmaduke, Crowleys Ridge State Park, Chalk Bluff Natural Area, Lake Frierson State Park, Oak Grove Heights, Lafe, St. Francis, Pollard, Greenway, Walcott, Saint Francis, Fontaine, Crockett, Knob, Halliday and Heubner. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
